intro: Myrsine athruphyllum, commonly known as the New Zealand myrsine, is a small evergreen shrub native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features lance-shaped leaves that are dark green and glossy on top, with a lighter underside. It produces small, white, tubular flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. The fruit is a small, round berry that turns red when mature, attracting birds that help in seed dispersal.
